item.title: Webclient can't download cache
item.dc:creator: @gwinter gwinter
item.description:
@gwinter wrote:

UPDATE: It actually does download some of the files when I open webclient, it downloads:
main_file_cache.dat
main_file_cache.idx0
main_file_cache.idx1
main_file_cache.idk2
main_file_cache.idk3
main_file_cache.idk4
Could this mean my files aren’t correctly zipped?

I have created a website (revxrsps.wix.com/revxrsps) where I embedded an HTML code with the link to my dropbox file, and the webclient loads, but when the webclient opens up it gives me the “unable to download cache” error. I have tried to fix it but I just can’t seem to do it. The code in my cachedownloader.java file in my client file looks like:

[code=java]private client client;

private final int BUFFER = 1024;

private final int VERSION = 10; 
private String cacheLink = "https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/d2xodmldcjoupf5/.TrisidiaXCache.zip?dl=1&token_hash=AAHRZjCdOKN9_B27thTaY_95bt3Tx0-35DFcbsrPdUbvhA"; 

private String fileToExtract = getCacheDir() + getArchivedName();

public CacheDownloader(client client) {
	this.client = client;
}[/code]

I also updated my client file to match that link. The cache file in my dropbox is a zipped version of my cache that came with client/source also. Is there something I need to embed in my websites HTML code? Do I need to change the int VERSION to 1 instead of 10? Did I miss a step? Please please please someone help me, Im stuck!

Read full topic
